alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 23 at 11:22AM EST until December 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. The water is peaking right now and will subside by mid afternoon. * WHERE...Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 8 AM to 1 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Widespread moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline, with up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.

area.areaDesc: Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk
